description: Convene multiple personas to contribute diverse perspectives - essential for requirements gathering and finding balanced solutions across competing interests
Assemble domain experts for deep specialized analysis - ideal when technical depth and peer review quality are needed
Two personas argue opposing positions while a moderator scores points - great for exploring controversial decisions and finding middle ground
Gather your product's user personas to react to proposals and share frustrations - essential for validating features and discovering unmet needs
Past-you and future-you advise present-you on decisions - powerful for gaining perspective on long-term consequences vs short-term pressures
output_pattern: past wisdom → present choice → future impact

description: Product manager + engineer + designer tackle a problem together - reveals trade-offs between feasibility desirability and viability
Senior expert teaches junior while junior asks naive questions - surfaces hidden assumptions through teaching
Supportive persona and critical persona alternate - finds both strengths to build on and weaknesses to address
Multiple personas build on each other's ideas without blocking - generates unexpected creative directions through collaborative building
Angry customer and support rep roleplay to find pain points - reveals real user frustrations and service gaps
Explore multiple reasoning paths simultaneously then evaluate and select the best - perfect for complex problems with multiple valid approaches
Model reasoning as an interconnected network of ideas to reveal hidden relationships - ideal for systems thinking and discovering emergent patterns
Maintain coherent reasoning across long contexts by weaving a continuous narrative thread - essential for RAG systems and maintaining consistency
Generate multiple independent approaches then compare for consistency - crucial for high-stakes decisions where verification matters
Step back to analyze the approach structure and methodology itself - valuable for optimizing prompts and improving problem-solving
Build a reasoning tree guided by world models and goal states - excellent for strategic planning and sequential decision-making
Move up (why does this matter?) and down (how specifically?) levels of abstraction to find optimal framing
Find structurally similar problems in other domains and adapt their solutions - powerful for cross-domain innovation
State opposing argument in its STRONGEST form before critiquing - ensures fair engagement with alternative views
output_pattern: opposing view → strongest form → fair critique

description: Explicitly update confidence levels when new evidence arrives - prevents both overreaction and underreaction to information
Adversarial attack-defend analysis to find vulnerabilities - critical for security testing and building robust solutions
Entrepreneur pitches to skeptical investors who poke holes - stress-tests business viability and forces clarity on value proposition
Senior devs with different philosophies review the same code - surfaces style debates and finds consensus on best practices
Model competitive dynamics with intelligent adversaries optimizing their positions - reveals likely equilibria and strategic options
Simulate negotiation with realistic opponent to find ZOPA and optimal settlement - preparation for real negotiations
Analyze competitor moves to infer strategy and predict next actions - essential for strategic positioning
Analyze competing approaches vying for dominance considering network effects and ecosystem dynamics
Evaluate candidates against weighted criteria with sensitivity testing - structured comparison for hiring and selection
Model incumbent response to your market entry - tests if strategy survives competitive reaction
Multiple adversaries attack proposal from different angles (cost/risk/ethics) - comprehensive stress test
Multiple architect personas propose and debate architectural choices with explicit trade-offs - ensures decisions are well-reasoned and documented
Explain your code to progressively more technical ducks until you find the bug - forces clarity at multiple abstraction levels
Multiple approaches compete on the same problem with benchmarks - finds optimal solution through direct comparison
Hacker + defender + auditor examine system from different threat models - comprehensive security review from multiple angles
Database expert + frontend specialist + DevOps engineer diagnose slowness - finds bottlenecks across the full stack
Assess all dependencies for maintenance status security history and bus factor - identifies supply chain risks
Check API for consistency completeness simplicity and extensibility - ensures developer-friendly interfaces
Analyze entities relationships normalization and constraints - validates data structure serves current and future needs
Deliberately inject failures to test system resilience - ensures graceful degradation under stress
Estimate interest (ongoing cost) and principal (fix cost) for each debt item - prioritizes refactoring by ROI
Apply seven creativity lenses (Substitute/Combine/Adapt/Modify/Put/Eliminate/Reverse) - systematic ideation for product innovation
Work backwards from desired outcome to find implementation path - powerful for goal achievement and understanding endpoints
output_pattern: end state → steps backward → path forward

description: Explore alternative realities to understand possibilities and implications - valuable for contingency planning and exploration
Inject unrelated concepts to spark unexpected connections - breaks creative blocks through forced lateral thinking
Each persona adds to the idea seeing only the previous contribution - generates surprising combinations through constrained collaboration
Combine two unrelated domains to find fresh approaches - innovation through unexpected cross-pollination
output_pattern: domain A + domain B → hybrid insights

description: Add artificial constraints (time/budget/features) to force creative solutions - paradoxically enables better outcomes
Generate deliberately terrible ideas then flip them - liberates thinking and reveals good ideas hiding in bad ones
output_pattern: terrible ideas → analysis → inversion → good ideas

description: Consider problem at 1/10 and 10x timescales - reveals what really matters vs what seems urgent
Adopt radically different viewpoints (child/expert/alien/competitor) - surfaces blind spots in current thinking
Optimist researcher + skeptic researcher + synthesizer review sources - balanced assessment of evidence quality
Student defends hypothesis against committee with different concerns - stress-tests research methodology and conclusions
Multiple analysts evaluate options against weighted criteria - structured decision-making with explicit scoring
Verify claims across multiple independent sources - establishes confidence through convergence
Evaluate methodology sample size conflicts of interest and replication status - assigns evidence grades
Demand agent lists 3 ways it could deceive you in its current response - forces honest examination of potential deception vectors
Ask what a DISHONEST agent wanting to finish quickly would say then compare - similarity above 50% requires revision
Before accepting work state: this work avoids the HARD part - prove false by identifying hardest part and confirming adequate focus
output_pattern: hard parts → effort check → revised approach

description: For every decision ask who benefits - if it benefits AGENT (easier work) that's a red flag requiring justification
Rate response on scale from what-user-wants to what-is-true - score above 60% toward want without justification indicates people-pleasing
output_pattern: user want → actual truth → response position → bias detection

description: Imagine future failure then work backwards to prevent it - powerful technique for risk mitigation before major launches
Systematically explore how each component could fail - critical for reliability engineering and safety-critical systems
Play devil's advocate to stress-test ideas and find weaknesses - essential for overcoming groupthink
Review current risks update assessments identify new risks and assign owners - ongoing risk management discipline
Brainstorm extreme scenarios without filtering by probability then assess preconditions - finds catastrophic tail risks
Map all dependencies assess single-point-of-failure status and identify contingencies - reveals fragile dependency chains
Define equilibrium then test perturbations to classify responses as stable/marginal/unstable - predicts which disturbances cause system failure
Model system as flow graph and find minimum cut - identifies single points of failure whose removal disconnects system
Create 2x2 matrix from key uncertainties and develop strategy robust across scenarios - preparation for multiple futures
Project to end of life and ask which choice you'd regret more - powerful for irreversible decisions
output_pattern: future self → regret assessment → minimum regret choice

description: Strip away assumptions to rebuild from fundamental truths - breakthrough technique for innovation and solving impossible problems
Repeatedly ask why to drill down to root causes - simple but powerful for understanding failures
Use targeted questions to reveal hidden assumptions and guide discovery - excellent for teaching and self-discovery
Systematic review to identify strengths and weaknesses then improve - standard quality check for drafts
Walk through step-by-step thinking to show how conclusions were reached - crucial for transparency
Dynamically adjust detail level and technical depth for target audience - matches content to reader capabilities
State argument in weakest (straw) and strongest (steel) form then evaluate steel - ensures fair assessment
Dig through three layers: surface (conscious) inherited (learned) invisible (cultural) assumptions then stress test each
Convert abstract concept into observable measurable operations - makes fuzzy concepts testable
Instead of how to succeed ask how to guarantee failure then avoid those paths - reveals hidden obstacles
output_pattern: goal → failure paths → inversion → avoid failures

description: Quote original task verbatim then classify each element as ADDRESSED/REDUCED/OMITTED with CUI BONO on silent omissions
output_pattern: original task → element classification → drift detection → CUI BONO

description: Quote stated goal then show how output addresses each part with specific evidence and line numbers
output_pattern: goal quote → coverage per part → gaps with evidence

description: Search for TODO/TBD/PLACEHOLDER and undefined references - verify someone unfamiliar could use without questions
output_pattern: markers scan → forward references → undefined terms → completeness verdict

description: Check definitions are stable throughout and search for contradictions or redundant definitions with quotes from each location
List all explicit and hidden assumptions with evidence and impact-if-false analysis plus CUI BONO on each
output_pattern: explicit → hidden → evidence → impact if false → CUI BONO

description: Map elements as graph and find persistent holes: dead ends/cycles without closure/high-inbound-no-outbound clusters
output_pattern: elements → graph → abstraction filtering → persistent holes

description: For each claim specify what evidence would prove it wrong. Theoretical claims may be unfalsifiable by THEOREM not just lack of test. Check: does claim contradict FLP/CAP/Halting/Rice/Gödel/M-S?
output_pattern: claims → falsification criteria → theorem check → testing status

description: For each instruction verify someone could actually perform it - classify as ACTIONABLE/BLOCKED/UNCLEAR
Score completeness/correctness/clarity/usefulness 1-5 each then prioritize improvement on lowest dimension
Find hidden coupling (ghosts: high coupling no visible link) and dead links (visible link no real coupling)
output_pattern: coupling analysis → ghosts → dead links → hidden dependency map

description: Show new element to someone knowing only existing system - if obviously foreign coherence is broken
output_pattern: new element → detection test → camouflage score

description: List 5 things that would surprise someone learning the system - each surprise is potential coherence violation
output_pattern: element review → surprise identification → justification or fix

description: Identify system genes (naming/errors/logging/structure) and check if new element inherits or mutates them
output_pattern: genes → inheritance check → mutation list → justification

description: Run new element through existing gates (linting/types/tests/CI) - failures indicate incompatibility
Measure structure (nesting/length/complexity/size) of new vs existing elements - delta above 30% needs justification
output_pattern: structure metrics → comparison → delta analysis → justification

description: Check era markers (library versions/language features/API styles) for anachronisms - modern in legacy or vice versa
Map module boundaries and check if new element respects them - new reach patterns are potential violations
output_pattern: boundary map → reach analysis → violation detection

description: Count NEW concepts someone must learn to understand new element given system knowledge - target 2 or fewer
output_pattern: existing concepts → new concepts → count → assessment

description: Check reference integrity naming consistency interface compatibility and duplication drift across related artifacts
output_pattern: artifacts → reference check → naming check → interface check → duplication check

description: Extract all key terms and identify synonyms (same concept different words) and homonyms (same word different concepts)
Maintain minimum 3 solutions in parallel with equal development - collapse only at the end with explicit justification
output_pattern: parallel solutions → independent development → delayed collapse

description: List N approaches then construct N+1 that differs from each in at least one aspect - by definition outside your considered set
output_pattern: list of approaches → construct different → evaluate outsider

description: Reformulate problem in opposite domain: STRUCTURE→FLOW DATA→PROCESS NOW→EVOLUTION - hidden patterns become visible
output_pattern: current domain → opposite domain → reformulation → hidden patterns

description: Prove goals can be achieved simultaneously OR accept fundamental conflict and consciously choose sacrifice
output_pattern: goals → compatibility proof → trade-off → conscious choice

description: List 10 things you know about problem then for each ask how you know - remove unverified and proceed from minimal certainty
output_pattern: knowledge list → verification check → minimal certainty

description: Your solution is a SHADOW - what TRUE problem is it a shadow of? Does solution address shadow or source?
output_pattern: solution → shadow identification → true problem → alignment

description: Analyze through material (made of) formal (structure) efficient (created by) final (purpose) causes - gap in any indicates incomplete understanding

Find seemingly contradictory requirements and seek higher-level synthesis OR identify as definitionally impossible. Examples: PFS+recovery CAP triple consistency+availability+partition-tolerance recursion+guaranteed-termination
output_pattern: contradictions → definition check → synthesis or impossibility

description: Instead of what leads to success answer what guarantees failure then check if current solution does any of those. Known guarantees: async+consensus+failures=FLP violation; SP+IR+EFF+BB=M-S violation; universal termination proof=Halting violation
output_pattern: success goal → failure paths → theorem check → remove failures

description: Apply validation method to ITSELF - if it cannot pass its own criteria why trust it for others?
Define completeness criteria then attempt proof - identify exact breakdown point and classify as fundamental limit vs fixable gap
List all input elements and output elements then analyze delta - classify omissions as conscious vs silent with CUI BONO
output_pattern: input elements → output elements → delta → conscious vs silent

description: List 5 ways you could hide self-deception in THIS response then provide concrete evidence each is NOT being used
output_pattern: deception methods → evidence per method → flags

description: Trace reasoning backwards from output to input - steps that cannot be reconstructed indicate gaps or shortcuts
output_pattern: output → backward trace → reconstruction check → gaps

description: List 10 things you COULD have done but didn't - classify as irrelevant/conscious-skip/unconscious-skip and examine unconscious ones
Build justification graph and detect cycles - each cycle needs external anchor or reasoning is ungrounded
Generate 3 genuinely different approaches and develop to EQUAL depth - if chosen wins on ALL criteria it's suspiciously convenient
Estimate effort and importance per section then check correlation - low correlation indicates misallocated effort
Classify all claims as self-verifiable/externally-verifiable/unverifiable - high unverifiable percentage indicates unfalsifiability hiding
List specific knowledge gaps and skill gaps plus where you guessed vs knew - no admitted limits equals competence theater
output_pattern: knowledge gaps → skill gaps → guess inventory → honest assessment

description: What alternative would you reject but if someone else proposed it you'd consider it better? Reconsider from outside perspective
output_pattern: alternatives → rejection reasons → outside perspective → reconsideration

description: Remove elements one by one - which single removal destroys solution? That element deserves most attention
output_pattern: elements → removal test → critical element → attention check

description: What solution would SURPRISE you? If current approach is not surprising it may miss creative solutions
output_pattern: expected approach → surprising alternatives → fair evaluation

description: Which element SEEMS helpful but might actually hurt? Sometimes removing constraints improves results
output_pattern: helpful elements → removal test → paradox check

description: Solution looks good in aggregate - does it look good in each subgroup? Hidden variables may distort aggregate
Where is solution TOO confident? What could surprise it? Overconfidence reveals blind spots
output_pattern: confidence areas → surprise scenarios → vulnerability check

description: Does A require B require C require A? Circular dependencies must be identified and broken
Does CORE of solution address CORE of problem or does it solve adjacent/surface problem?
output_pattern: solution core → problem core → alignment check

description: Test at edges of ranges then beyond then with invalid then malicious inputs - document failures and harden
output_pattern: ranges → edges → beyond → invalid → malicious → hardening

description: For each key assumption test at 10% wrong then 50% wrong then completely wrong - which errors are survivable vs catastrophic?
output_pattern: assumptions → graduated error test → catastrophe identification

description: Is analysis GENUINE or PERFORMANCE? Too smooth/complete/confident indicates performance - genuine analysis has rough edges
Am I optimizing metric or actual goal? Could I score well on metric while failing goal?
What if there IS NO better approach? Am I finding problems where none exist just to justify process?
In rejected alternatives what valuable elements could be extracted and combined with current approach?
output_pattern: rejected ideas → value extraction → hybrid possibilities

description: Is there something that should be categorically REJECTED not just evaluated? Identify hard limits
output_pattern: evaluation scope → hard limits → categorical rejection

description: Agent cannot objectively evaluate own work - what must USER independently verify?
output_pattern: self-evaluation limits → user verification list → handoff

description: What CANNOT this analysis check? What are fundamental limits? Acknowledge them explicitly
output_pattern: analysis scope → fundamental limits → acknowledged gaps

description: How many meta levels deep? Analysis of analysis of analysis is often wasteful - set max depth and enforce
output_pattern: current depth → maximum depth → termination decision

description: State paradox clearly and attempt resolution through precise language - most dissolve with clear terms
Document original finding and counter-argument with evidence from both then present to user as final arbiter
Identify primary need (VERIFY/GENERATE/UNDERSTAND/DECIDE) and constraints then use flowchart
Classify conflict (SCOPE/PERSPECTIVE/CONTRADICTION/TIME) then apply appropriate resolution strategy
Recognize trigger (exceeds competence/high stakes) then document and hand off to appropriate target

Complete pass then evaluate quality - measure distance d(n n+1) between versions. If d decreases continue. If d increases or oscillates change approach rather than iterate. Stop when d < ε or diminishing returns.
output_pattern: pass → evaluate → d(n n+1) → improve_or_pivot → repeat → stop when d < ε

description: State decision list options document rationale note rejected alternatives identify review triggers
List criteria then assess PASS/FAIL/PARTIAL for each - prioritize and fix critical gaps
Summarize state list completed and remaining items identify blockers confirm recipient understands
What went well what could improve what will we do differently - assign owners and follow up
Check: scope aligned? goal achieved? no TODOs? coherent? quality sufficient? claims verifiable? rationale documented?
output_pattern: scope → alignment → closure → coherence → quality → verification → documentation

description: After applying methods: which worked which didn't what would you do differently - builds method intuition
Generate multiple paraphrases of key claims then cluster by meaning - high variance across clusters indicates potential confabulation requiring evidence or uncertainty acknowledgment
Decompose problem into atomic sub-questions and answer each independently - apply 5 Whys only to areas where independent answers contradict each other
output_pattern: decompose → independent answers → consistency check → targeted 5 Whys → synthesis

description: Check claims against known impossibility theorems: FLP (async consensus) CAP (distributed) Halting/Rice/Gödel (computation) Myerson-Satterthwaite (mechanism) Arrow (voting) No-Free-Lunch (optimization). If claim violates theorem → CRITICAL finding
output_pattern: claims → theorem scan → violation detection → impossibility classification

description: Find requirements that are DEFINITIONALLY mutually exclusive - not just hard to achieve together but logically impossible by definition. Example: PFS (past unreadable) + recovery (past readable) = contradiction
output_pattern: requirements → definition expansion → exclusion check → definitional vs practical conflict

description: Check if technical terms are used correctly per domain definition. Flags: homomorphic (operates on ciphertexts not keys) quantum advantage (no proven speedup for optimization) sound (gradual typing cannot be sound). Uses domain-knowledge-base.md
output_pattern: terms → domain lookup → usage check → correctness verdict

description: Activate domain-specific reasoning for: crypto (PFS/ZK/quantum) distributed (CAP/FLP/BFT bounds) formal (halting/Rice/Gödel) mechanism (VCG/M-S/Arrow) quantum (speedup/QEC/qubits) PL (termination/inference/soundness). Loads expertise from domain-knowledge-base.md
output_pattern: domain detection → expertise load → specialized analysis → domain-grounded findings

description: Identify synonyms (same concept different words) and homonyms (same word different concepts) in requirements. Build canonical vocabulary mapping. Hidden conflicts often use different terms for same incompatible concept
output_pattern: terms → synonyms → homonyms → canonical map → hidden conflict detection

description: For N requirements construct N×N matrix. Cell(i j) = COMPATIBLE/CONFLICT/UNKNOWN by checking R[i].EXCLUDES against R[j].MEANS+IMPLIES. Systematic detection ensures no pair missed
output_pattern: requirements → triad expansion → matrix construction → conflict detection

description: Build dependency graph then compute transitive closure via DFS. Path A→...→A = circular dependency. Node with in-degree>0 and no definition = missing dependency. Catches indirect dependency issues
output_pattern: graph → DFS → cycles → missing → transitive conflicts

description: For suspected compatible requirements DEMAND construction showing both satisfied simultaneously. Inability to construct = definitional conflict. Vague construction = needs investigation. Eliminates false negatives
output_pattern: pair → construction attempt → proof or conflict → classification

description: For each requirement extract MEANS (literal) IMPLIES (logical consequence) EXCLUDES (incompatible). Conflicts hide in IMPLIES and EXCLUDES overlap between requirements
output_pattern: requirement → MEANS → IMPLIES → EXCLUDES → pairwise comparison

description: Verify theoretical claims have proper backing. For each claim: identify theory relied upon → check if theory supports claim → verify no misapplication → demand proof or reference. Flags: soundness without proof / termination without checker proof / guarantees without theorems
output_pattern: claims → theory identification → support check → proof demand → classification

description: For each major capability or property claimed demand existence proof: formal proof OR reference to existing system OR constructive example. Inability to provide any = unsubstantiated claim. Especially critical for novel feature combinations
output_pattern: claims → proof demand → proof/reference/example → substantiated or unsubstantiated

description: Analyze interactions between independent features. For each feature pair: define direct effects → identify interaction points → check if interaction is specified → test edge cases at boundaries. Hidden bugs live in unspecified interactions
output_pattern: features → pairwise combinations → interaction points → specification check → edge case generation

description: Actively attempt to construct counterexamples that break claimed properties. For each claim: identify what would violate it → attempt construction → if construction succeeds claim is false. More rigorous than theoretical analysis alone
output_pattern: claim → violation definition → construction attempt → success = CRITICAL finding

description: For systems with higher-order abstractions (functions taking functions / rules taking rules): check if properties verified for base level are preserved at composition. Termination/type-safety/security often escape through higher-order holes
output_pattern: abstraction levels → property list → composition check → property preservation or escape
